data.title: Welcome to FluxStore
data.desc: Fluxstore is on the way to serve you.

data.title: Connect Surrounding World
data.desc: See all things happening around you just by a click in your phone. Fast, convenient and clean.

data.title: Let's Get Started
data.desc: Waiting no more, let's see what we get!

items.title: The four seasons
items.description: Discover the four seasons, create scenes for spring, summer, autumn and winter, talk about time, weather and nature and have a better understanding of the world through play. Great activity to learn new vocabulary and create your own world

items.title: Rainbow large loose parts
items.description: Loose parts are shapes that can be rolled, stacked, lined up, hid, etc. and they can become anything the child wants and something different any time. Loose parts don't have a specific purpose so it's up to the child's imagination to become something. They can be great combine with your child's favourite figures or characters to compliment their world and take their imagination to a whole new level. Plus let's admit it... they are beautiful!

items.title: School day small world
items.description: Children communicate through play. With a simple set up like this, kids can talk about their family, friends and themselves all through play. It is a great set up for starting school or to help kids set up expectations about friends and family and understand their environment better. You can use the figures to explain what happens in a day when they go to school. Let them play and express themselves with no instructions. If you observe you might discover and learn things about your child too.

items.title: Oats farm
items.description: Using oats as a sensory base, this activity is suitable and safe for all ages. Kids will practice fine motor skills scooping the oats with the tongs and spades, feeding the animals and drawing on them with their fingers, or putting them on the vehicles. These eco friendly vehicles are also a very versatile toy for indoor and outdoor play. Learn and practice vocabulary through play.

items.title: Safari world
items.description: Our step a stones not only help kids develop confidence and gross motor skills (movement and body control), but they can also be used foro pretend play as houses, mountains or boats, as well as they can be used as seats at home, kids can pretend they are the seats on the airplane or a train. Find them combined with our safari toobs here, learning about parts of the world, animals, landmarks and more. Children will feel curious and want to learn more as they play.

items.title: St Patricks sensory play
items.description: Exploring traditions and cultural inheritance through sensory play. Children will explore meaningful colours, shapes, textures, materials... while being curious and creative. As kids play they will develop communication by explaining what they are doing, fine motor skills by picking up items, problem solving by creating things they need to play and so much more.

items.title: Frozen figures rescue
items.description: Frozen figures for the win! Simply put some figures into a lunchbox, add water close and freeze overnight. Use droppers with warm water to free the figures, you can also use water based paint to paint the ice, etc. Great simple science activity for all ages.

items.title: Water science play
items.description: Learn the basics of science mixing water with a few drops of paint and combine, predict, explore and discover what happens.

items.title: Numberbloks maths fun
items.description: Play with numbers and learn maths through play with numberblocks. Sort out colours and shapes and create your own figures, discover how reflection works, keeping everything contained in this versatile tray also suitable for messy play.

items.title: Bark farm
items.description: Exploring textures and using vocabulary to describe the different animals, talk about where they live, what they eat, what sound they make... Our 4 items to set up this tray are fine motor tools (tongs and scoops), figures (farm animals and cars), containers and sensory item (bark). Children will develop imagination, creativity and problem solving skills as they combine the items, explore and create.

items.title: Dough loose parts creations
items.description: Get creative combining the different items on the tray. Mad mattr is a playdough-like material that never dries out. Stick, hide, lace or stack the items to make your own creations and start over and over again.

items.title: Toddler play area
items.description: The way you display the toys at home will have a direct impact on how kids play and interact with their environment. Too many toys can be overwhelming. Separate each toy so they know where they belong and use tidy up as an activity to help them develop communication (narrate what you do, name the items...) and sense of order and belonging.

items.title: Arctic coding
items.description: Coding activities help children anticipate and predict behaviours and consequences. It also helps them udnerstand spacial awareness, direction and instructions. With this sensory activity kids will be curious as they explore out polar prints and animals, learn about the world, sequence penguins to talk about direction and journeys, tell stories and communicate their learning. Kids can also use the mad mattr as a sensory material to create shapes and explore cause effect as they mould it and build with it.

items.title: Creative painting
items.description: Get creative painting and combining colours and shapes. Use playdough cutters to stamp different shapes with paint, cotto buds, paint brushes and your own fingers to create different shapes and patterns.

items.title: Elf on the shelf home
items.description: Create a little adventure for your elves, dolls or favourite figures with our magnetic tiles and favourite yellow door resources. Children can develop social skills (understanding others), communication, fine motor skills and so much more when they create pretend play activities like this.

items.title: Rocky road
items.description: 4 items to set up a tuff tray: fine motor tools (tongs and scoops), containers (cardboard tubes and dump trucks), figures (cars and roads) and sensory item (rocks). When you combine these 4 items (they can be different each time or even just replace one of them) kids will use their imagination to bring it to life.

items.title: Moon Sand Space Adventure
items.description: Travel to space with your imagination and your hands. Create moon sand simply mixing flour and vegetable oil to create a texture that you can mould. Add these figures and fine motor tools to create your space adventure while develop it fine motor skills, coordination and communication.
